Name: Crapsize
Description:
"You and the other players are competing to contract cargo ships which will bring valuable goods to port. Staying out at sea too long is risky, as weather can endanger your entire fleet. Will you gamble on long voyages for big money, or will you play it safe and stay close to home?"

Shipping lanes are made up of 7 cards 1-6 and another for scoring. You roll dice not at sea and can choose pairs to go to sea or not. One die chooses where to start and the other is the value of the cargo.

Then you roll two dice to see if a storm shows up and whether you lose any of your ships. Ships lost are removed and can be rerolled again next turn.

Finally move your ships forward (towards the lower number), if any move to zero and onto the scoring card earning points through a multiplication; doubles can net you a couple of bonus points.

If anyone reaches the 100 point goal or more the highest score wins.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Contest of Powers
Description:
Role-play gods and goddesses of European pantheons in deadly skirmish for Heavens! Deduce who's your ally and who's your enemy, while bluffing your way out of intrigues. Fast and rules-friendly game, brimming with player interaction.

Your goal is to determine who is your 2 allied players and then, eliminate all other players before they get you. Alternatively, you may gather enough Power from Otherworld and sacrifice it on your Pantheon's altar.

Every round you take two actions, which will determine your position on Transcendency Oak, available power & artifacts (in form of cards) and your Stamina. You may engage in duels, battles and rituals - or simply just lick your wounds and plan your revenge.

Name: Cat Capers: Museum Heist
Description:
Gather the family for a clever game of quick captures with Cat Capers! Cat Capers is an interactive tabletop card game for up to 6 players. To play, line up the five 3D objects in a circle and shuffle the deck of cards. Each player must sit on one hand throughout the game, where the object is to identify the match or missing object on the card in play. Be the first to capture the right (or missing!) object, and keep that card. If you grab the wrong object, you must return your card randomly to the deck. Collect the most cards to become the ultimate cat caper!

Cat Capers includes five 3D objects and 60 playing cards.

Name: Páros Játszma
Description:
Páros Játszma is a board game that raises serious and funny questions between couples living and in love together that they think they know about each other. 
The board game reveals whether we know each other well.

Sure, it raises conflicts in several cases, but that makes it an interesting game. 
Dormant desires, dreams, or even annoying little things can come up. Get to know yourself wisely!

Couple vs couple game mode:
This board game is actually a dating quiz where it can even turn out that friends know the couple better than they know each other.
Going through the fields of the board, you will encounter many good-natured, provocative, or surprising questions, if you know your partner’s answer in advance because you know him/her well, you can move quickly to victory!

Name: Vindication: Villages & Hamlets
Description:
The island of ruins and resurgent magic still holds many secrets. Packed with new map regions and cards to explore and leverage, this module set also introduces new ways to discover, control, and interact with every location as well as methods to include more tile options in each game. Want more; have more. It's your journey.

—description from the publisher

Name: Käpt'n Kuller
Description:
The pirate gang has collect huge piles of loot, and to distribute the treasures, they've decided to play the legendary pirate skittles game.

Who will manage to make the ball roll skillfully down the launch tube in Käpt'n Kuller to hit the desired diamonds and in the end collect the most gold coins?

Name: Participation Award
Description:
"You and the other players must work together to defeat monsters, but you're all a bit lazy and really don't feel like working too hard."

Interesting game in that if the team does well, the players that did the most work earn the least points, but if the team did poorly, then those that pulled more than their weight do get the most points.

The game plays in rounds until the target score is reached; this is calculated based on the number of players. Each player gets 4 dice per player contributing one to the monster pool in the center. Roll the monster dice and that is what you the total you need to beat the monster. Roll your 3 remaining dice and secretly choose some number of those to defeat the monster.

Then you will score based on success or failure relative to where you fall your the contribution. Once one player gets to the target the game ends with the highest score the winner.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Flying Frog DiceFest 2020 Goody Box
Description:
A promotional box of goodies made for sale during the virtual DiceFest held in 2020.

The promotional box includes:
For Shadows of Brimstone

     The Lost Marshals Enemy Record Sheet
     Cartwright's Trusty Pistol - Mine Legendary Artifact (First legendary artifact) - Promo 337
     Black Fang Hatchet - Canyons Artifact - Promo 269
     Veteran Preacher miniature with Sculpted Base


Harvester Otherworld Threats

     Harvesters - Belly of the Beast Otherworld Threat Card - Promo 488
     Harvesters - Forest of the Dead Otherworld Threat Card - Promo 489


Trederran Raiders Otherworld Threats

     Trederran Raiders - Belly of the Beast Otherworld Threat Card - Promo 490
     Trederran Raiders - Forest of the Dead Otherworld Threat Card - Promo 491


    
For Fortune & Glory

     Heroic Survival Card - Event - Promo 032
     Shroud of Menace - Villain Event - Promo 033


 
For A Touch of Evil

     Heroic Survival Card - Event - Promo 065
     Shroud of Menace - Mystery - Promo 066


 
For Last Night on Earth

     Heroic Survival Card - Hero Deck - Promo 069
     Shroud of Menace - Zombie Deck - Promo 070


 
For Invasion from Outer Space

     Heroic Survival Card - Hero Deck - Promo 009
     Shroud of Menace - Martian Deck - Promo 010


 
Other:

     1" collectible button - these were randomly inserted into the boxes so the design may vary from the one pictured.
Families: Series: Last Night on Earth Game Engine (Flying Frog Production)

Name: Ничего человеческого Мини
Description:
The year is 2025, and it's been a long time since the robots have taken over the Earth. Now it's time to pass the final test to prove that you have nothing but oil in your veins and no trace of humanity left, and there's no better way to do this than to demonstrate your perfect memory!

Your goal in Are You a Human? is to guess the three characteristics of the cards. Guess card features and score points in a way that boosts player interaction, forces you to assess the risks, and makes everyone involved in the exciting process. Pass the captcha of the nasty robots!

Contain 48 Memory cards and 3 Short Circuit cards instead of 64 and 6 cards in standard version.

Name: Liquid Courage
Description:
"You and the other players are Dwarves. After centuries of peace, Dragons now threaten your way of life. Tunnel into long forgotten mines to find the tools to help you survive the onslaught. With Dwarven beer to bolster your courage, only the bravest Dwarves will be celebrated as legendary heroes!"

This game is played in rounds and you want to gain 6s per round to score points, but you need to be able to get those and 1s to keep rolling. Keep pushing your luck trying not to bust to improve your score.

When someone breaks 50 points or higher at the end of a round the game ends and the highest score wins.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Black Fang Hatchet
Description:
Available from the promotional box of goodies made for sale during the virtual DiceFest held in 2020.

Black Fang Hatchet - Canyons Artifact - Promo 269

+ 1 Combat.

Use 1 dark stone to add +3 damage to one of your critical hits.

Tribal, Traveler, or Frontier only

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Cartwright's Trusty Pistol
Description:
Available from the promotional box of goodies made for sale during the virtual DiceFest held in 2020.

Cartwright's Trusty Pistol - Mine Legendary Artifact (First legendary artifact) - Promo 337

Shots are equal to the hero's lore ability.
While you have 1 hand open, use the d8 for damage.

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Harvesters Otherworld Threat Cards
Description:
Available from the promotional box of goodies made for sale during the virtual DiceFest held in 2020.

- Harvesters - Belly of the Beast Otherworld Threat Card - Promo 488
- Harvesters - Forest of the Dead Otherworld Threat Card - Promo 489

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Trederran Raiders Otherworld Threat Cards
Description:
Available from the promotional box of goodies made for sale during the virtual DiceFest held in 2020.

- Trederran Raiders - Belly of the Beast Otherworld Threat Card - Promo 490
- Trederran Raiders - Forest of the Dead Otherworld Threat Card - Promo 491

Name: Shadows of Brimstone: Undead Outlaws and Undead Gunslinger Deluxe Enemy Pack – The Lost Marshals Enemy Record Sheet
Description:
Available from the promotional box of goodies made for sale during the virtual DiceFest held in 2020.

This is an enemy record sheet representing The Lost Marshals.

Name: Think Fast!: Disney Edition
Description:
Put your Disney knowledge to the ultimate test in this Think Fast party game from Ridley's Games where you know all the answers! In this Disney edition of our popular, fast-paced trivia game Think Fast!, teams go head-to-head in 3 rounds. With each round the answers stay the same, but the questions get harder, until you're only given one word! You have 30 seconds to answer in, so you need to Think Fast if you want to win! Get your Disney and Pixar facts at the ready to solve questions on Princesses, Villains, Sidekicks and so much more!

Includes 240 question cards, score pad, sand timer, pencil and instructions.

—description from the publisher

Name: Duello
Description:
"In this tense game of give and take, you must know when to attack and when to guard. Boost your own score or steal from your opponent? Only one you is left standing in the end!"

This is a game of taking turns swapping locked dice to try and achieve the highest sum. It's actually clever in that it uses both a single die and your opponent's rolled dice as potential locking mechanisms.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Stuffed Fables: Lost Story #1
Description:
This lost story is a stand-alone adventure for Stuffed Fables that can be inserted between chapters 3 and 4 if players are enjoying Stuffed Fables as a campaign. This exciting story sees the Stuffies battling on the streets of their town with the dreaded Dollmaker and his newest contraption!

—description from the publisher

Name: Puzzle Panic
Description:
A whopping word whizz? Marvellous at maths? Love your letters? Ridiculously good at riddles? Then it’s your chance to shine as you battle it out to find the speediest puzzler!

The rules are simple. Everyone races to solve each puzzle and the first player to crack it and ding the bell wins the round!

Will you be super quick or will you panic under the pressure?

—description from the publisher

Name: Cum Face Game
Description:
This hilarious duel pump action penis game is like nothing else you’ve seen and the perfect party piece for bachelor and bachelorette parties and other fun-filled events.

How to play… Before you begin, pour liquid into the hole positioned between the two shafts. We advise water but any safe to consume liquid can also be used.

The object of the game is to pump the penises as quickly as possible to be the first player to squirt their opponent in the face, or mouth, and be declared the fastest w@*ker. Then, pass it on to the next contenders.

Fill it up and start pumping, be quick though, or you’ll get a face full. Let the games begin.

—description from the publisher

Name: Vampire Hunter: The Card Game
Description:
Vampire Hunter is a single deck card game where players try to become the best Vampire Hunter by killing undead blood suckers and collecting their fangs. The first player to collect fifteen fangs is the winner. That said a player can also win by being the last player left. This is a game for two to four players.

On their turn, a player must take one of three actions. Either visiting the city to equip themselves with weapons and other items, attacking one of the colorful yet horrifying enemies lurking within the city, or using and equipped item. If you are unable to take any action, you must discard one of your precious items card and take a damage.

Variable deck set-up and character selection (each with a unique ability) means no two games will play exactly the same.

Name: Creature Comforts (Kickstarter Edition)
Description:
Creature Comforts: Kickstarter Edition includes the following items not included in retail version of this game:
- Talents mini expansion
- Dreams Come True mini expansion
- Game Trayz storage solution
- Wooden Resources

Life in the forest is a lot of fun, at least while the sun is shining and the leaves are on the trees. Those days don’t last forever though, and long before the weather starts to change, the wise animals start to harvest for the long cold winter ahead. You will spend many months tucked into your burrow and you want to make it as cozy as possible. A nice bowl of soup, a comfortable rocking chair, and some toys and games will go a long way to make those dark winter days pass by quickly.

In Creature Comforts, you spend the Spring, Summer, and Fall gathering different goods from the forest and spending them to collect items that will make your home more inviting while the world outside is covered in a layer of snow. Each round you send family members out to various locations in an attempt to gain supplies. If they fall short of their goal, they’ll learn a lesson and be better prepared next time. The family that has created the most comfortable den wins the game.

Name: Une saison au zoo: Le jeu du soigneur
Description:
Find the animals from your favorite show A Season at the Zoo!
Test your knowledge of Zoo de la Flèche animals and the profession of healer with 1,140 questions.

Draw a map and complete both missions to go from trainee to healer. To do this, join the 2 missions that are assigned to you by answering the various questions accessible to the youngest about the animals of the zoo and about the profession of caretaker.

To have even more fun, several cards are illustrated! It's up to you to guess which animal has been blurred, who owns the coats and fingerprints, or find the solution to the rebus!

Name: Ten Break
Description: Ten Break is a card game that simulates a single or doubles tennis match

Name: Battle of the Bismarck Sea
Description: Battle of the Bismarck Sea is a Pacific Air campaign included with C3i #16 for the Down in Flames game series, specifically the titles Zero! and Corsairs and Hellcats.

Name: Weird but True!: The Game
Description:
Weird but True!: The Game is a trivia game for 2 to 5 players aged 8 years and up. Based on the National Geographic Kids app and book series, players take turns reading wild facts from over 200 questions for everyone to discuss, debate, and decide the correct answer.

Each player gets a chance to answer every question for the chance to move ahead on the spiral game board. Some questions allow for multiple winners; others only allow one winner. The first to the Winner's Circle wins.

There are five categories of questions, including:  

     Fact & Fiction compares two seemingly unlikely facts for the players to determine which is true. 
     Brain Blitz is a timed elimination challenge for each player to name items from a given topic without hesitating or repeating one already mentioned. 
     What's Your Number? seeks for each player to guess as close as possible to an outrageous number included in a fact.

Name: The Game of Life Pop-O-Matic Trouble Game
Description:
It's a Game Mashup: The Game of Life and Trouble.

As with the Game of Life game, players move their car token around the board, but in this edition it's not about a career and earning money -- it's about getting car tokens filled with pegs to get them Home first. The Trouble game's Pop-O-Matic die roller is now combined with The Game of Life spinner to create a fun popper-spinner!

Name: Amphibious Fleet
Description:
Amphibious Fleet is a stand-alone game from Technical Term game company in Japan. It is an addition to Victory Games, "Fleet" series.

Amphibious Fleet is set in the South China Sea. Most scenarios involve China conducting an amphibious invasion of an island in the South China Sea, while the owners of the island attempt to resist China's efforts.

Please note that while the map and counters are marked in English, the rules are in Japanese.

Name: Killer Party: Bone Appétit
Description:
Who murdered Celebrity Chef Basturdly? Compete against your friends to solve a culinary crime in Killer Party’s Bone Appétit!

Six to twelve amateur sleuths can play this whodunit party game. To crack the case, collect Clue Cards and use your deductive skills to piece together the events of the crime. But there’s one catch: the only way to get a Clue Card is by performing a crazy stunt! What will you do to get a clue? You and your fellow detectives work your way through three envelopes, until someone solves the case! Sure to get increasingly wacky and hilarious, Killer Party is equal parts fun and challenging! You must use your deductive reasoning and strategic thinking in order to score points and find Chef Basturdly’s killer! At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins! In the event of a tie, you’ll have to take on another mystery – like Killer Party’s Kiss of Death!

Will you be the one to crack the case? Test your sleuthing skills with Killer Party’s Bone Appétit: the social mystery party game!

—description from the publisher

Name: A2/AD Fleet
Description:
A2/AD Fleet is a modern air and sea fighting game from the Technical Term game company in Japan. A2/AD Fleet takes place in the Malacca Strait and the Andaman Islands. The game is an addition to Victory Games' "Fleet" series of games.

A2/AD is a military term for "anti-access/area denial, and A2/AD Fleet does touch on A2/AD tactics. China, India, the United States, Myanmar, Thailand, Malaysia, and Singapore are all represented with ships and aircraft. The action takes place in the Malacca Strait and the Andaman Islands, some of the busiest waterways in the world.

Name: Allgäu fertig los
Description: You get in the saddle with a few friends to explore this oasis of the European countryside on your bike. But you want to make it more exciting and decide on a race that will lead you through the Upper, Lower, East and West Allgäu. Everyone gets their own target points, everyone chooses the supposedly shortest route. Actually, everything was really easy if it weren't for the many little adventures and tasks that lurk for you along the way. Only one thing helps: full throttle until „Lälla“ hangs out

Name: A Tchi?
Description:
Cooperate or compete with friends in this original card game based on Acadian tradition. See who can best remember their family tree while discovering a unique collection of Acadian names!
The first player draws a card from the stack and flips it over. They state their own name, followed by á (as in catch) and the card name.  After this, the next player does the same, starting their own stack.
The challenge is to remember the family tree while only seeing the topmost card. 
If a player forgets their family tree, they are out.  The last player to remember their ancestors wins!

Name: The Friendship Game
Description:
Friends are at the heart of a good life – and what we want when we get together with them is an opportunity to share what is really going on inside us as well as the chance to hear about what has touched, moved or preoccupied them.

This is a game designed to get the very best out of our friendships. Played on a board with a dice and cards, it invites us to ask one another a series of kind but searching questions about our lives. The more honestly and clearly we answer, the faster we advance around the board. The winner of the game is the person who has best demonstrated that bedrock of true friendship: the capacity for sincere, kindly self-disclosure. The game is guaranteed to bring out new facets of our friends and will allow for a series of fascinating moments of revelation and mutual discovery.

The cards cover four categories:

     Love
     Work
     Self
     Family


Questions cover topics such as:

     Have you ever been secretly a bit attracted to someone you probably shouldn’t have been? (Light)
     Have you ever acted on this attraction? (Heavy)
     Do you have a strong sense of right and wrong? (Light)
     Have you ever violated your own moral code? (Heavy)
     Have you ever complained about a colleague’s behaviour? (Light)
     Has anyone complained about your own behaviour in the workplace? (Heavy)


—description from the publisher

In The Friendship Game, players score points by giving out information about themselves. Each turn, a player will roll the dice and move their pawn forward. Then, they get a question based on the location they landed on. They can choose to answer the light version of the question, the heavy version of the question, or neither. If they choose to answer the question, the other players will judge if the player has shared fully; if they feel this is the case, the player scores points.

The game ends when a player has reached the end of the track; the player who has scored the most points wins the game.

—user summary

Contains Game Board, 4 Sets of 24 Cards, 6 Wooden Counters, 1 Wooden Dice | 197 x 197 x 35mm | Instructions included | 3 - 6 Players | Suitable for 15 years +

Name: Leftovers
Description:
"Compete for points each round, but the player with the lower total for the round gets to keep the leftovers as a bonus. Outwit your opponent and finish with the top score!"

This is a 2 player game...

A set of dice are rolled and put in plain view. Then each player rolls a dice and sets an additional one to match a value of one of the center dice keeping it secret as well.

Repeat play until someone gets 50 or more.

They reveal their dice and then figure out what to remove. This then creates a set of left overs.

The set die + the rolled dice for each player are summed and scored based on whether they odd or even they will score differently. Whoever got a lower score so far gets the left over center die.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Blue's Snack Match Game
Description:
MINIATURE REFRIGERATOR WITH BLUE: Press down on Blue to see what snacks are in the fridge. The snacks in the refrigerator will spin, giving you a new combination of snacks with every turn!
NOT YOUR EVERYDAY MATCHING GAME: Players take turns making matches between the refrigerator and their lunchbox. If, on your turn, a snack in your lunchbox matches what’s displayed, place a token on the item!

BASED ON THE SHOW BLUE’S CLUES: Blue is back and more popular than ever. With rules following the unique structure of the show, players learn valuable skills like reasoning and matching.

QUICK START, FUN AND ENGAGING: Open the box and you’ll find everything you need to play, including easy-to-follow instructions.

—description from the publisher

Name: Howzzat
Description: Rain or shine choose to play your favorite game of cricket inside the comfort of your very own home Choose your team members, become a captain and lead your team into play Make wise strategic decisions that will change the course of the game every minute and keep your opponent on the defense-always Are you ready for the most important match of your life Play " the game of cricket "

Name: Christmas Rush
Description:
Christmas RUSH is an elimination game and played like the popular card game Spoons.

Game cards are quickly passed between players as the iconic sounds of the holiday season echo in the air. "Merry Christmas," "Jingle Bells," or "Bah, humbug," fellow players might say but don't get too distracted by all the ruckus and fray. Your goal is to collect a set of four identical cards and beat the Christmas RUSH for a game token or else you are out of the game!

The Twist...
Six special action cards add even more excitement to this fast-paced game! Say the phrase printed on these cards when passing them to other players or sing a couple of words from your favorite Christmas carol as you pass the Sing card.

Contents: 62 game cards, 7 Christmas game tokens, and game rules.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Purple Meeple Eater
Description:
"You and the other players are all giant, radioactive monsters, smashing your way through the city, munching on local residents. Which of you is going to be the biggest, baddest monster of them all?"

Roll and score each round. You score high or low dice based on whether you get rolled a 1 or not. If your dice are all 1s,  you bust scoring 0 for this turn.

You then decide whether to stop and score OR continue and roll the remaining dice. Play rounds like this until someone gets 50 or more points.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
Families: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

Name: Twilight Struggle: Blame Canada Promo Card
Description:
Tribute card created by Jason Matthews in response to South Park featuring Twilight Struggle in an episode (season 23, episode 07, hence this is card #2307!)

If the US Controls Canada, remove 2 influence and smack nearest Canadian.  
Remove from play if used as an event.

Included with C3i magazine issue 33

Name: Dungeon Dash!: A Hero Kids Dungeon Crawl Card Game
Description:
Dungeon Dash! is a push-your-luck card game set in the world of the Hero Kids Fantasy Role-Playing Game. Each turn you can venture further into the dungeon in search of gold and magic items. Be careful, though, because traps and fierce monsters are in these dark tunnels too!

The print-and-play version of the game comes with rules, 77 dungeon cards, 12 character cards (with color art from the Hero Kids game) and 8 magic item cards. You’ll need to supply some six-sided dice and about 10-15 chips per player.

—description from the publisher

Name: The American Experiment
Description:
The Thirteen Colonies have gone from a restless bunch to a group of independent entities.  Throughout the process, a number of documents and other writings have played an integral role in motivating the citizenry and justifying the need for Independence.  As a publisher, your goal is collect and publish more parts of these documents than your competitors.  Publish a significant portion of a document or series of writings and you will attract Advocates that will boost your score. But beware, there is a heavy price for beginning a collection and under-delivering.  Or, will you take the ultimate risk and publish only Loyalist writings?

The object of the game is to gain points by playing cards to different collections of writings. A card played to a collection represents one part of a published writing. But, there is a catch - once you begin publishing to a collection your score in that collection starts negative. You must continue publishing to that collection to achieve a positive score in it. Once to have played three cards to a collection you may also play Advocates to the collection which can double, triple, or quadruple your score.

On a player's turn, a card is played either to a collection or to an appropriate discard pile. Then a card is drawn to replace the played card, either from the deck or from the top of one of the discard piles. Cards played to one of the player's collections must be in ascending order, but not necessarily consecutive. Play continues until the draw pile is exhausted at which point the players scores are tallied.

If a player decides to publish the Loyalist writings, they may only play to the Loyalist collection and no other collections, their initial score is doubly negative, and all cards in the Loyalist suit are double valued. It is a high risk, high reward option.

-description from designer

Name: Knights of the Round Table
Description:
After many years of campaigning, the Knights of the Round Table have returned home.  Their greatest desire is to enjoy a round of their favorite game.  To their dismay, while they were away marauders destroyed all their copies of the game and it is no longer in print.  Out of sheer desperation, the Knights resort to re-implementing the game in their own style as an honor and tribute to the original.

Knights of the Round Table is inspired by King’s Court, the out-of-print cult classic card game issued in 1983 by Janjohn Games, Inc.

This game is a wild re-imagining of UNO with more complex draw cards, wild cards, and other special cards. Some draw cards chain together; others allow you to skip or change the direction to affect different players. Defensive cards allow you to protect yourself or even deflect an action back on the instigator. The goal of each round is to play all of your cards first while the goal of the overall game is to have the lowest score when any one player exceeds 500 points.

-description from designer

Name: Creepy Crawley Castle Game
Description:
One player is the scantily clad "Victim" trying to escape the horrors of the Creepy-Crawley Castle to reach the "Castle of Safety"... the other players are a Mummy, Werewolf or Vampire trying to catch her! The victim will have a head start but the path to salvation is strewn with both dubiously useful weapons and horrifying setbacks (for victim and villain alike). And that dastardly gargoyle at the end may even decree that EVERYONE loses, dear reader... thus the corpse crumbles.

This is one of five somewhat tongue-in-cheek games from Warren magazines (publishers of Creepy, Eerie, Vampirella and others) that features their rad 70s artwork, creepy critters, sly wit and perilous situations in classic monster chase "spin and move" gameplay.

The Creepy Crawley Castle Game was created by Bill DuBay and appeared in Creepy magazine #55 (August 1973) and Eerie magazine #50 (August 1973) as inside the magazine cover items, ready to cut out and play, and separately in 1974 as a bundle of "Warren Monster Madness" games by mail order (#2661 for $2.50). The bundle included Capture, Monster Match, Creepy-Crawley Castle (aka Creepy Castle), Werewolf! and Monster's Castle.

Name: Unity: Solo Challenge 1 for Renegade Scout 2nd Edition
Description:
On the quiet mining world of Keshen III, miners and colonial militia have begun defecting and opening fire on loyal security forces. Meanwhile, unidentified military ships are descending from orbit.

Welcome to the first Solo Challenge for the Renegade Scout miniatures rules.

This offers an infantry assault scenario that can be played on your own or with a friend cooperating to "solve" the scenario. You can use any force you like, with the aim being to beat the scenario using the smallest possible points value.


     You need 14 infantry figures for the enemy forces. Your own force can be as large or small as you like with 200-250 points (using the Army Builder) being a good starting point. 
     Mechanics for solo play are included. 
     3 difficulty toggles are provided to bolster the enemy forces. 


The scenario is well suited to help learning the rules, experimenting with different forces and exercising your army building muscles.

Name: The Corsican: Wargaming the Napoleonic Wars
Description:
MAIN FEATURES
1) Rules developed for different scales, from 28mm to 6mm, at the Regiment level.
2) An original mechanism - using Action Dice - that randomizes the actions that each troop will be able to perform in the turn and gives the commander in chief (the player) the responsibility of distributing these orders with or without privileging certain Troops.
3) An original mechanism - called Action Cards - that, by means of a deck of printable cards, randomizes random events in each turn, granting bonuses and penalties to the armies involved in the combat.
4) An original combat system, which uses randomised dice rolls to determine the outcome, while maintaining a high level of reality in the confrontations between Infantry, Cavalry, and Artillery.
5) Lists with the main Generals, with quality grades for each of them (for use in-game).

WHAT DO I NEED TO PLAY?

     Dice - The system uses 6-sided dice (d6)
     Measuring tape - Measuring tape is used to determine movement distances, weapon range, etc in centimetres.
     Miniatures - Miniatures represent your army. We suggest using miniatures on scales from 6 to 28mm.
     Action Cards - We provide a deck of Action Cards that you will need to copy and print.
     Scenarios - These are designed to match the real terrain on the battlefields. You can use your own ideas to build scenarios.
     Opponents - Invite friends to a fight over the dinner table. You will become generals for a few hours.


—description from the publisher's website

Name: Werewolf!
Description:
Two to six players will race to determine which house a hungry werewolf is in, who actually died to the fiend, and what the real human identity of the brute is! Will you play as Red Peepers, Scarlet O'Hare, Pinkie Claw, Cherry Pitts, The Scarlet Crimson (aka Crimson Pimpernel), or Ruby Lisp? Rush to one of 4 creepy houses and make your three dire accusations: "The Werewolf is X player, the victim is X player, and it was done in THIS house!" The other players will consult their cards and if they can disprove one of the accusations must show the card to the accuser.

Much like the classic game Clue, through a process of possibility elimination and logical deduction, a player's accusation will inevitably be correct and they will win the game.

Possibly the best part of the game (or even the only good part?) is the Warren Publishing empire's trippy 70's artwork, featuring a crimson wash of decaying mansions, madly capering denizens and some rather hard to read text. Well, what did you want from a horror magazine publisher anyway? Too bad Vampirella doesn't appear on this one - she's so... toothsome.

This is one of five somewhat tongue-in-cheek horror games from Warren magazines (publishers of Creepy, Eerie and Vampirella) featuring campy 70's horror boardgame fun. The Werewolf! game was created by Bill DuBay and appeared in Creepy magazine issue #57 (November 1973) and Eerie #52 (November 1973) inside the magazine covers to cut out and play, and separately as a bundle of "Warren Monster Madness" games by mail order (#2661 for $2.50). The bundle included Capture, Monster Match, Creepy-Crawley Castle (aka Creepy Castle), Werewolf! and Monster's Castle.

Name: Dragon Lords: Heroes and Villains
Description:
Dragon Lords: Heroes & Villains is our first big box expansion for Dragon Lords: The Battle of Darion. This expansion adds powerful new dragon, knight, unit, upgrade, spell, and order cards to your Dragon Lord army. Also included are new dragon miniatures, player mats, dragon dice bags, and Dragon Lord custom dice.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Portal: Demo Game
Description:
This Demo Game of contains 24 game cards from the Magic the Gathering â€” Portal trading card game, a tip card, and two instruction sheets — everything two players need to play their first Magic games. All you need is a brain, this Demo Game, and a friend.

—description from the publisher

Name: Celebes: The Anomalous Island
Description:
You are sent to an adventurous journey to the heart of Celebes, an anomalous island of Indonesia. Wonders are everywhere. Birds, butterflies, mammals, and insects are dazzling with beauty. And you have the best mission in the world: to collect and study them all! This will definitely be your lifetime expedition.

Celebes offers games that can be enjoyed by families, which can be played by 2-4 players. The main mechanics of the game are Point to Point Movement and Set Collection. Each player will be provided with a set of logistics cards, botanical tokens and cash. The player's task is to move from one point to another to get data on flora & fauna endemic there. Each turn the players will play one logistic card, later the value printed on the card will be additional travel capital for this turn. If they want to retrieve data, they have to pay a certain amount of money to be able to put the botanist on the game board following the existing path. Players will get a flora / fauna card if they succeed in placing their botanists in a new area.

At the beginning of the round there will be one event card that is opened, this card can change the playing conditions and change the player's tactics. The game ends when the last event card has been executed. Players will get points for having a certain set of cards. However, a new set is counted when the total is more than three cards of the same suit. If there are only one or two cards in a set, the value does not count or is considered forfeited. The player with the most Victory Points wins!

Name: Wtedy kiedy: Szalone fakty
Description: An expansion to "Wtedy kiedy" game. It contains 110 new cards.

Name: ANZAC Fleet
Description:
ANZAC Fleet is based on the Victory Games (and now Compass Games) 'Fleet' series of modern naval warfare games.

This game focus is on modern naval operations in the Java Sea.

ANZAC Fleet features forces from the US, Australia, New Zealand, Indonesia, and others. This includes naval surface forces, submarine, and air forces.

Name: Wtedy kiedy: Magia kina
Description: An expansion to "Wtedy kiedy" game. It contains 110 new cards.

Name: Wtedy kiedy: Sportowe emocje
Description: An expansion to "Wtedy kiedy" game. It contains 110 new cards.

Name: Wtedy kiedy: Niezwykła Polska
Description: An expansion to "Wtedy kiedy" game. It contains 110 new cards.

Name: High Society
Description:
The idea of the game is to get into the Blue Book or Social Register of "High Society" in the middle of the board. Naturally, more than just money is required for admission. Players must also possess their own estate, a piece of property, four status symbols, 200 liquid asset points (money), and a formal invitation. This game is about acquiring all those items and being the first to make it into the Blue Book.

High Society is designed primarily for four players, although rules for five to eight players are also included. Players move their pawns around the track by means of dice rolls or to specific spaces specified by "strategy cards". Players acquire an estate or property by being the first to land on it. After acquiring an estate or property, they may be able to charge a trespassing fee to players who land on it. Players also acquire Status Symbols and points (money) by landing on any of the eight Status Symbols spaces.

Players gain or lose points and Strategy Cards or Status Cards as they land on spaces around the track. Any player who cannot pay their debts is eliminated. Once a player has all the requirements for admission to the Blue Book, they proceed to one of four Country Club Lane paths to the center of the board. Once a player is in one of the Country Club Lane paths, they roll the dice to advance. At the last space before the Blue Book, the player rolls one die and specific rolls determine whether they lose a turn, return to their estate, or win the game. A player in Country Club Lane may also be "Blackballed" by another player in which case they return to their estate space on the board.

Name: Gruff: Twist Gaming Promo Pack
Description:
The pack contains:
2 alternate art card of Gruffs: Gaptooth and Zumberg
1 promo Gruff: Mulch
2 promo Sheperds: Kringle and Krampus

Pack was one of the rewards during the Twist Gaming 2019 Kickstarter campaign.
Families: Folk Tales & Fairy Tales: Three Billy Goats Gruff

Name: Imperial Settlers: Empires of the North – Treasure Island Promo Cards
Description:
2 extra island cards that have to be shuffled into their respective decks. The cards are marked ‘Treasure islands 01 - 02’.


    01 Forgotten Treasure Island (Nearby Island)
    02 Legendary Treasure Island (Distant Island)


Pack was one of the rewards during the Twist Gaming 2019 Kickstarter campaign.

Name: The Most Terrible Battle: Borodino 1812
Description:
"The Most Terrible Battle: Borodino 1812" is an introductory wargame at the division level of perhaps Napoleon’s most famous battle next to Waterloo.

The game includes the meeting engagement of September 5, 1812 as well as the main battle of Borodino fought two days later.

The game design is suited for beginners and more experienced players alike as it includes features such as square formations, heavy cavalry charges, the Fleches, and the Shevardino and Grand Redoubts, Cossacks, garrison units and a non-player reaction phase.

The game map for Borodino is based on a modified style and color of maps created by historians of the battle in the decades immediately after the battle.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Elfmeter!
Description: Both player simultaneously tries to play the right cards. One takes the role as attacker, and tries to pass the ball three times and take a shoot at the goal. The other player is trying to prevent exactly that. If he succeeds and grabs the ball the players immediately change roles.

Name: Dragon Royale
Description:
2-6 players compete for draconic dominance over the locals and each other. Pillage villages & castles for loot, defend your domain from opposing dragons, and hoard wealth & cards to achieve victory!

12 unique dragons each with special mechanics and base stats - Select your favorite, draft from a few, or fully randomize!

Your abilities and stats may guide your strategy but victory is never certain: React on-the-fly as the die can help or hinder at any moment.

As you conquer villages and castles your hoard will fill up. Build a juggernaut loaded with stats and passives, become a true spellslinger with a flurry of cards, or carefully construct the perfect endgame combo!

Name: Hippopoly
Description:
Hippopoly the first board game of Hippo Basket Salerno.

Try to score points, the winner is the first player to reach 50 Victory points.
Victory Points are earned by winning matches.
Games are won by collecting Strengths.
Strengths are obtained with training.
Each space color indicates a different action to take (pick a card, score strength point, score victory points etc...)

Name: Izzat So
Description:
Izzat So is subtitled on the box top as "A Family Fun Game of Witty Proverbs and Old Saws." 
The object of the game is to make complete proverbial sayings from a collection of phrases which appear on small rectangular tiles. The tiles are in several colors and some include a point value. The proverbs that can be formed are listed on a scoresheet as a reference.
Each player in turn rolls two dice, draws that number of tiles from the face-down "boneyard" and attempts to form said proverbs. There are also rules for swapping and stealing tiles from other players and from the discarded tiles from previous turns.
The game continues until all 60 proverbs in the list have been formed. Scores are then tallied to determine the winner.

Name: Disney Charades
Description:
You draw an "I am" and a "Who" card, then roll two dice to determine what Disney character you are miming and what they are doing. Your team has one minute to guess as many pairs of cards as possible. Players can mime and make noises, and the team can guess as many times as they like until they find the correct answer and get a point.

There's 25 cards in each pile and you keep playing until they run out. The team with the most points wins.

Contents:
25 'I am' Cards
25 'Who' Cards
1 Blue Die
1 Red Die
1 Timer
1 Set of Rules

Name: Sleeping Gods: Zokmere Polearm Promo Card
Description:
A Zokmere Polearm weapon card for Sleeping Gods. This weapon card can be equipped to a crew member. It has +3 accuracy, deals 3 damage (and can deal +1 additional damage if you discard 1 equipped savvy card), and provides 1 block (2 if you miss).

Available as part of the Man vs Meeple Season 3 Kickstarter.

Name: Glades
Description:
GLADES is an enthralling two-player strategy game that combines territorial control with clever tile placement. Set on a 9x9 grid, players use domino-like tiles to carve out and claim empty spaces called glades. The game unfolds in two distinct phases: a tile-laying phase where players strategically place their tiles to create and influence glades, followed by a scoring phase where ownership of these valuable empty spaces is determined.

During the tile-laying phase, players must navigate a series of placement rules, creating a delicate balance between expanding their own territory and blocking their opponent. The unique matching mechanism, where tiles must connect to opponents' tiles with matching suit values, adds an extra layer of strategy and interaction.

As the board fills up and options dwindle, the game transitions into the scoring phase. Here, the true test of strategic foresight begins. Glades are claimed based on the highest surrounding suit values, with a clever cancellation mechanic.

-description from designer

Name: רקוז (Rikuz): Concern
Description: Rikuz: Concern is a Monopoly-style game with Israeli landmarks in Hebrew and English that was originally released in the 1950s by Israeli publisher Bar Levy when Monopoly was not available in that country.

Name: Mathe-Meister
Description:
Mathe-Meister is a free roll and write, print and play game, supporting one or more players. Players will dynamically create simple mathematical equations and attempt to solve their sums towards maximum victory points. However, players must be careful how they create each equation based on its location. Producing an odd or even sum in the wrong location, turns said sum into negative points! Over eight rounds, players roll dice, write operands and operators, utilize gameplay bonuses, and ultimately collect their victory points into a final score. The player with the highest final score wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Dungeon Academy: The Forbidden Mountain
Description:
Are you ready to deal with both ice and fire on this formidable excursion? The Forbidden Mountain is teeming with unprecedented dangers, against which neither your mukluks nor your sunglasses will afford enough protection.

—description from the publisher

Name: Csonti
Description:
Grab the most bones for your doggy!

Place all five bone cards on the center plate square. Deal 28 tiles to each player and place the decks on the yellow squares.
The first player draws a tile and places on the first square marked with an arrow. The red line must be continuous. Then it is the other player's turn, who draws a tile and places it on the first square. The game continues until one player reaches the center square and grabs one bone card. If the line goes out the game field, or runs into the other players line or ends in a dead end, the player must remove all his/her tiles and discard them. Then he/she must start from square one.

The player who gets the most bones of five, wins.

Name: COREWARDS
Description:
"Rejoice, for the signs are clear.
The presaged time has come.
All shackles of caste and clan are exiguous now.
Goyum beckons and the faithful gather.
Now, we must travel...  COREWARDS."

A lore-heavy game set in an original semi-hard sci-fi universe, this game focuses on a card-based travel mechanic, with players competing to reach the entity known as "Goyum" first, who awaits them in the Milky Way's center.
Focusing on card memorization and deck manipulation, these travels are represented by three shared decks of cards, each containing chances to buy or sell various types of cargo, rare offers to obtain upgrades as well as more dangerous encounters.

COREWARDS requires you to manage three shared decks to further your own advantage, that is increasing your chances to reach Goyum first. This requires balancing your risks against potential gains, as well as tracking which cards are in play and in which deck at the moment. The game's unique selling point is the fact that the game's three card decks are manipulated collaboratively by all players each turn, instead of building one's own individual deck.

—description by the designer

Name: Sjön
Description:
Bring a Swedish lake to life with plants and animals. From the same team that bought you the smash hit Swedish Design Prize-winning game Skogen (The Forest).

As well as being filled with forests, Sweden is also covered with lakes: about 100,000 of them, to be exact. You're never more than a short distance away from a large body of water; or the wealth of plants and animals that call it their home.

In Sjön, you get to celebrate – and create – the Swedish lake ecosystem in all of its feathery, scaly, slippery, spiky, beautiful, frightening, peaceful and predatory glory. As with its predecessor Skogen, you start with a blank canvas – an empty lake – and then your job is to fill it, slowly but surely, with life. You do this by selecting the "elements" required for living things and placing them on the lake bed: once a few are in place, you can start populating.

Before long, the full dynamic beauty of the ecosystem will bloom into life, and the interdependence of the species on each other, as well as their environment, comes into play. Your lake will be teeming with leeches and perch, dotted with lilypads and frogs, crewed with ducks and menaced by hawks. Nurture your lake as best you can, gain points for the most exciting and rarest species that you manage to introduce, and be careful of – and grateful for – the capricious forces of nature that wreak beautiful chaos on your environment.

Name: Vuureiland
Description:
When you arrive at Fire Island, everything seems like a paradise. But there is a volcano which is becoming very active, and only one player will be able to survive this nightmare...

The game board exists of a standard setup of hexagonal tiles, with the volcano in the middle of the board. On your turn, you play one of the six standard action cards that are the same for every player, like sprint/walk/push & steal/dig/look and rest (to get your action cards back). Every turn you play two action cards, and you try to dig up special treasures like God cards, which will give you special actions.

But, there is a caveat. There are ten rounds in the game, and every round the volcano spreads across the island, dictated by the random direction of the wind. The player who plays his cards right, who is able to receive the favour of the gods and who is able to stay away from the lava, will survive and will be the only one left standing... Let the nightmare begin!

—user summary

Wanneer je aankomt op Vuureiland, lijkt het met zijn slaperige vulkaan en witte stranden recht uit een droom geplukt. Maar schijn bedriegt. Terwijl de vulkaan langzaam ontwaakt, wordt er ook iets in jou wakker. Je vermoedt dat dit verhaal mogelijk langzaam een nachtmerrie wordt; een nachtmerrie die eindigt in goud en bloed.

Verover machtige schatten, paai wraakzuchtige goden en schakel sluwe tegenstanders uit voor de vulkaan uitbarst. Ben jij klaar voor de ultieme vuurproef?

—description from the back of the box

Name: Scrutiny: It's All About Me!
Description:
How well do you know your friends and family, and how well do they know you? Find out in this hilarious all-play board game that will have you laughing out loud with every game that you play!

Scrutiny: It's All About Me! sees players taking turns to be put in a scenario where there are three possible outcomes. The player in the spotlight has to choose which of the three outcomes best relates to them. All other players have to guess the outcome they chose. Every turn sees a new challenge, and with six thousand possible scenario outcomes, it's a different game every time you play it!

—description from the publisher

Name: Jungle Tribe
Description:
The jungle’s tribe chief has passed away. The time has come, for you as a young tribe member to prove, yourself and show that you should become the future leader. You still have much to learn so you decide to complete 3 dangerous Quests through the jungle: a journey to search for the 3 great masters in order to learn from the Wisest Elder, the Strongest Tribesman, and the Jungle Saint.

The game is played in two phases. In phase 1, players try to pick their 3 quests strategically, and in phase 2, players try to collect as many points as possible while completing their 3 quests through the jungle. Once a player completes all three quests, the game ends. The player with the most points wins the game. Points can be obtained in four ways: (1) Level of the player's Quests, (2) Successfully played Experience Cards through dice-rolling mechanisms, (3) Special Cards in the player's hand at the end of the game - hand management mechanism requires players to keep the best combos in their hand, and (4) completion bonus when having completed all 3 Quests.

-description from designer

Name: Houlala
Description:
Small pocket game which could be a drinking game as its challenges lend themselves well to it. The game consists of series of cards with one task (counting from 0 to 20 or from 20 to 0) with one condition, e.g.  for all the numbers of 5 letters say "bing" or if your number contains a T raises your fist, etc.
Players around the table each count in turn. If no one is wrong, add a new condition (to a maximum of four).
Players can choose to play together or to eliminate players who made a mistake.

—user summary

Name: Qube: På spåret
Description:
Trivia game based on the popular swedish quiz show "På spåret". Two teams takes three turns each, guessing a city destinations and answering questions about them.

On a turn the active team first tries guess the destination by listening to progressively easier clues. For each clue needed, the points value for the correct answer drops, but a wrong answer scores 0 points. Then the active team is asked four questions related to the destination, worth a point for each correct answer.
The team with the most points at the wins.

Name: Emil i Lönneberga: Äggjakten
Description: A roll-and-move game where players and Emil tries to collect the most eggs by gathering hens from around the garden. The players can also try to take hens from the hen house, guarded by Emil's pig. At the end of the game the hens are turned over and the player with the most eggs win.

Name: Turducken
Description:
A dastardly game of deception all in the name of a great dinner! Watch out for your fellow hunters and drive them into the rails as fast as you can so you can be the one feeding the family!

Turducken is a fast paced game that focuses on player interaction with a "take that" game style. The game is for 2-6 players that are 10+ years old and usually takes anywhere from 30 minutes to an hour to play. Winning the game is the name of the game, hunt and kill yourself a Turducken. One chicken, one duck, and one turkey is all you will need to win. Your chosen hunter has special abilities and you can gather and play action cards to help yourself or damage your opponents ability to hunt. A great family game with high replayability from multiple hunters to control and very dynamic game play from player interaction.

The rules are pretty simple, you can shoot at a bird (but make sure to name it first!), reload, draw /play action cards. You have a likelihood to hit that is different for each hunter that you have to roll above and each hunter has a special ability. Each hunter has a number of hits each bird must take from their weapon before they are dead. The action cards can be bonuses, minuses, or ways to mess with your opponents.

-description from designer

Name: När då då?: Resor i världen
Description:
A standalone expansion for När då då (The Best of Chronology) with cards containing trivia related to travel and journeys in history.

Gameplay is similar to the original game. On the players turn, an opponent draws a card from the deck and reads the text on the card. If the player successfully points out where the card should go in their current timeline, the card is added above the player Time lock and the player may then either decide to end the turn and move the cards above the time lock to the safety below it or try to get another card. If the player fails to place a card correctly, all cards gained in the current turn are lost, the turn ends and play passes to the next player.

The winner is the first player to win five cards.

When used with the original game, the cards from this game is added as another category. A new six-sided die and cardboard markers 1-6 are included to choose the category.

—user summary

Name: Mako Naval
Description:
Mako Naval is a game around the naval battle theme. Each player must cross the ocean with his ship and reach the other side before the others ships, while sinking and delaying the others ships thanks to mines.

On his turn, the player moves his boat forward one space in the direction of his choice and then rolls the die. The die indicates how far he can land a mine in any direction he chooses.

If the mine hits another boat, it returns to the starting point. If not, the mine stays and block the boat from others colors.
A boat can pass over a square with a mine of its own color and recover it.

The first boat to arrive on the other side of the board, facing its starting point, wins.

Name: Les fous du volant
Description:
This game is taking place in the universe of the "Wacky Races" cartoon. The goal is to drive first one of your car in the right colored space at the opposite of the board. It's a game without any chance, only strategy.

When a car has to move, the player choose one of the three spaces in front of him. It can't go back or on a side space. All cars, from the beginning to the end of the games should be on spaces that touch either at an angle or on a side another car.

Name: Blanc-manger Coco Galette Complète
Description:
Galette complète is the ninth expansion for Blanc-Manger Coco. It contains 40 question cards and 160 answer cards themed about Brittany.

One player is designated "question master" and reads a blue card with a hole-in-the-wall sentence (s), all other players pose a white card. Whoever posed the funniest card wins the round then reads the next blue card and so on. The first player with 5 points is the lucky winner!

Name: The Unbelievable Truth Game
Description:
Based on the hit BBC Radio 4 panel game, the Unbelievable Truth Game is a game in which the truth is stranger than fiction. If you can tell fibs without batting an eyelid or you can embroider the truth like a pro, then this is the game for you.

Players take turns trying to smuggle unbelievable truths past their opponents in a series of quick fire and lecture rounds. If you can spot when a "truth" is fact or fiction, ring the bell to win a point.

Name: レディファースト (Lady First)
Description:
ãƒ¬ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ•ã‚¡ãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒˆ (Lady First) is a shedding game from Japan, with each card controlling which successive cards may be played.

The game has a romantic theme, with one set of red cards themed for a woman, and a blue set for a man. Each cards carries various romantic lines (all in Japanese), that the players ought to speak as they play, such as

"Don't let me go"
"I'm glad to see you"

However, the game is designed for any adult players, not simply opposites.

The red deck has 12 cards numbered from 1 to 12 (and this player starts), the blue deck has 11 cards from 2 to 12. If the blue player can get the red player to play all 12 of their cards first, blue wins. Otherwise, blue loses.

On their turn, a player may draw one card from their deck, up to a hand limit of five, or play a card to the table.

Along the bottom of each card is a set of numbers, one for blue and one for red. These say what card can be played after this card. For example, the blue 5 can be followed by a blue 2,3,4 and 6 or by a red 4 or red 6-12.

As players go through their deck, they must carefully decide which cards to hold and which to play, in order to push more cards out of their opponent's hand.
user summary

Name: レディファースト (Lady First)
Description:
ãƒ¬ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ•ã‚¡ãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒˆ (Lady First) is a re-implementing of ãƒ¬ãƒ‡ã‚£ãƒ•ã‚¡ãƒ¼ã‚¹ãƒˆ (Lady First), with additional sets of cards to allow 3 or 4 players as well as the original 2 player game. Two sets of male cards have been added, otherwise the gameplay is the same.

The game has a romantic theme, with one set of red cards themed for a woman, and blue sets for a man. Each cards carries various romantic lines (all in Japanese), that the players ought to speak as they play.

Players draw and play out hand cards, with a set of numbers on each card controlling which others may follow it. If the blue player can get the red player to exhaust their cards first, blue wins. Otherwise, blue loses.

The red deck has 12 cards numbered from 1 to 12 (and this player starts), the blue deck has 11 cards from 2 to 12. On their turn, a player may draw one card from their deck, up to a hand limit of five, or play a card to the table.

Along the bottom of each card is a set of numbers, one for blue and one for red. These say what card can be played after this card. For example, the blue 5 can be followed by a blue 2,3,4 and 6 or by a red 4 or red 6-12.

As players go through their deck, they must carefully decide which cards to hold and which to play, in order to push more cards out of their opponent's hand.
user summary

Name: Treasure Cats
Description:
In Treasure Cats you play as an anthropomorphic cat trying to find treasure. Each round you will choose to go to the one of two Locations. The Junkyard or the Farmstead,to find Items. Each Item has a Value. At the end of each round, players reveal their Treasure Cards and see which Location yielded the highest  Items value. All players who chose that Location get a Victory Point.

Objective:The first player to score 5 Victory Points wins if no other player has 5 or more Victory Points. 6 Victory Points wins if no other player has 6 or more Victory Points.7 Victory Points everyone with 7 shares the win.

Setup:Pick a starting player. At the beginning of each round, the starting player shuffles the cards and deals 2 cards face-down to each player. Then they deal 2 of the remaining cards face up in the center of the play area. Each round has 3 phases.

Phase 1: Choose Treasure Cards. 
Opening with the Start Player and moving clockwise, each player will choose a card in their hand as a Treasure Card. They will place this card face up in front of them. Using the other card, hide either the top or bottom half of the shown Treasure Card so that only the Item or Location is visible. *This is very important!

Phase 2: Trigger Active Abilities                                                                      
Beginning with the Start Player and continuing clockwise, each player displaying an Item with an Active (A) ability may use it.
For example, if a player is showing the Compass, they would choose another player with a revealed Item. The targeted player would have to discard their revealed Item card if they correctly guessed the targeted players location. 
Note: A player can only be targeted by the Compass, Abacus, Whistle and Dog Mask once per round.

Phase 3: Award Victory Points                                                                               
All players now reveal their chosen Treasure Cards unless their Treasure Card was discarded in Phase 2. Each player with a Treasure Card showing a Passive (P) ability may now use that ability.
Add up the value for each Item at each Location. The Location with the highest value of Items wins the round.
Each player with a revealed Treasure Card with the winning Location receives 1 Victory Point. If there is no winning Location, then all players with a revealed Treasure Card earn 1 Victory Point. If a player had to discard their Treasure Card, then they cannot receive Victory Points.
After Phase 3 is complete, check to see if any player has achieved the winning objective. If not, then pass the Start Player token clockwise and start a new round.

-description from publisher

Name: Wantotrip: Le Tour Du Monde
Description:
The game was created by a Tunisian travel start-up to fight the pandemic.

The players start with the same amount of money and travel the world, rolling dice. 
When they arrive in a new country they have to pay for their stay (based on the average cost for each country), then they can continue travel, or decide to work there.
They just don't have enough cash to go around without stopping by and working in some of these locations (answering trivia questions).
They can also play special cards (Cruella) to delay their opponents.

The winner is the the first player to complete the World tour.
The goal of the game is also to teach tricks to players for their future travels.

There is an expansion for kids (optional but not sold separately !)

Name: Grimdark Future: Jakob's Path – Narrative Campaign
Description:
Jakob’s Path is a narrative campaign for Grimdark Future that follows the story of Jakob, a ruthless Battle Brothers captain, in his quest to conquer the Orc world of Zeloria-M5, whilst searching for a mysterious artifact.

This game expansion for Grimdark Future takes players on an adventure across 10 missions which are tied together by an exciting story of epic proportions. Rules for unit progression are also included, so you can watch your armies grow and evolve throughout the campaign.

Even though this narrative campaign was written with Battle Brothers and Orc Marauders in mind, it is easy to imagine this type of clash to be happening between any of the other factions in the galaxy, so feel free to swap them out with whatever armies you have available to play.

Note that to play this campaign you’re going to need the core rules for Grimdark Future as well as some army lists

Name: Moral Conflict
Description:
From the questionable to the downright detestable, it's time to find out what your friends really think of you with this game of moral dilemmas!
From "which of us is most likely to complain in a restaurant?" to "which of us is most likely to go to jail for tax evasion?", take turns to read out the cards and nominate a player.  It's the perfect party game for bad people!

—description from the back of the box

Name: Dyreskoven
Description:
Join in on an adventure in the forest, where you will meet a lot of funny and cute animals.

The Animal Forest is a fun game for children that will take you no time to learn. However, no game played will be the same, as the game evolves differently every time you play.
Every player will get a plate, which consists of several pictures of animals, which need to be collected, in order to win the game. You should beware of the Big Bad Wolf, as collecting him will make you unable to win the game!

This game combines picture lottery with trading, stealing and collecting a lot of animals.

Name: Beint í mark
Description:
A football (soccer) trivia game for the whole family, with almost 3,000 questions included. The questions are divided into four categories, but the fifth category is the penalty box, where players can get into various kinds of trouble - or score straight into the goal! Three levels of difficulty, so players of all ages and experience can compete on level ground. Be the first to complete all the questions and get to the finish line!

—user summary

Name: Now That's What I Call Music: The Board Game
Description:
From New Romantics and Britpop to house and rap, this is the soundtrack to our lives. Re-live the last few decades of great music in this fast-moving board game based on the chart-topping NOW THAT'S WHAT I CALL MUSIC albums.

—description from back of box

Name: The Best of Christmas Game: Not For Kids
Description:
OK, so we admit we're not famous for naughty games. Clean-cut family games - that's us. But occasionally a silly, hilarious and ever so slightly crude idea occurs to us that needs an outlet and here it is: Best of Christmas NOT FOR KIDS. It's a bit of light-hearted grown-up trivia that's just a smidgeon too naughty for the younger kids, but still full of the laugh out loud fun that makes the LOGO family a British favourite!

From office party antics and their aftermath to what time we first reach for the bottle on Christmas Day, Best of Christmas NOT FOR KIDS covers the messy, boozy, mistletoe-clad reality of Christmas for adults - and from our research, most of us are making the naughty list.

—description from back of box

Name: Quick 6 III Scenario Pack
Description:
Third pack of six short Advanced Squad Leader tournament scenarios. These were designed for the 2020 West Coast Rumble.

Q13 – One Last Attempt – Dom Bütgenbach, Belgium, 22 December 1944: Game Length: 5½ Turns; Board q;  Americans: 5½ Squads, 2x Leaders, 2x Machineguns, 3x 60mm mortars, & Bazooka; vs. Germans: 6x SS-Squads, 3x Leaders, 2x Machineguns, & JdgPz IV/70; Estimated Playing Time: 2 hours 21 minutes

Q14 – True to Form – The Factory, Carroceto, Italy, 25 January 1944: Game Length: 5½ Turns; Board 71; Germans: 8x Squads, 4x Leaders, 2x Machineguns, FT, 2x DC, & 2x StuG 75/34(i); vs. British: 5x Squads, 2x Leaders, 3x Machineguns, & PIAT;  Estimated Playing Time 2 hours 38 minutes

Q15 – Mantes Meet Up – Mantes-Gassicourt, France, 27 August 1944: Game Length: 6 Turns; Board 10z; Americans: 11x Squads, 4x Leaders, 6x Machineguns, 2x Bazooka, & 3x M5A1; vs. Germans: 11x Squads, 3x Leaders, 4x Machineguns, & 2x StuG IIIG; Estimated Playing Time: 3 hours 26 minutes

Q16 – Defence of St. Oedenrode – St. Oedenrode, Holland, 17 September 1944: Game Length: 6 Turns; Board 59; Americans: 5x Squads, 2x Leaders, 3x Machineguns, 60mm Mortar, & Bazooka; vs. Germans: 10x Squads, 3x Leaders, & 3x Machineguns; Estimated Playing Time: 2 hours 31 minutes

Q17 – Absorbing the Thrust – Furnes, France, 28 May 1940: Game Length: 5½ Turns; Board 10z; French: 8x Squads, 3x Leaders, Machinegun, & 3x H35; vs. Germans: 6x Squads, Gun Crew 2x Leaders, Machinegun, 50mm Mortar, ATR, & 2x 3.7cm Anti-Tank Gun; Estimated Playing Time: 2 hours 50 minutes

Q18 – Seize the Crossroads – Briqueville, France, 29 June 1944: Game Length: 5½ Turns; Board 17; Germans: 5x Squads, Gun Crew, 2x Leaders, 2x Machineguns, 75mm Infantry Gun, & Fortifications;  vs. Americans: 12x Squads, HS, 3x Leaders, 2x Machineguns, 2x 60mm Mortars, 3x Bazookas, FT, & 3x DC; Estimated Playing Time: 2 hours 32 minutes

Each scenario is played on half a map board with a handful of counters per each side; these scenarios are fast, with a limited amount of SSR, to ensure minimum set up time and maximum game time.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Twisted Dungeons
Description:
Never venture in the same old dungeon again.

Twisted Dungeons is a supplement for Four Against Darkness, suited for all levels of play, that will change your dungeons forever.

It’s easy to use: just roll d88 (two eight-sided dice) as the adventure starts, and read the corresponding numbered entry. The book will inject unpredictable events and themes into your dungeon exploration: 64 dungeon complications, ranging from mosquito infestation to teleporting mirrors, from slippery tunnels carved out of ice to chambers with magic-enhancing properties. Most complications will come with interesting rewards, in experience or loot.

Twisted Dungeons may be used alongside its companion volume, Twisted Minions, to create even more random variations. With a bit of common sense, it will work with any book in the Four Against Darkness line.

Name: The Shape Chomper Game
Description:
One of Mattel's All-Together games, with no loose pieces.  From the instructions:
"Be the first player to collect one of each of the four shapes before the SHAPE CHOMPER can gobble any of them up!"

Name: The Lost Clans (fan expansion for Age of War)
Description:
Lost Clans introduces 5 new clans to the game, with a total of 12 new cards.  These clans add more difficult combinations and allow for a better experience with 4+ players.  The clans are as follows:

Utsunomiya - 1 card (4 pts) - 4 flipped
Saito - 2 cards (3 pts each) - 6 flipped
Otomo - 3 cards (2 pts, 3 pts, 4 pts) - 11 flipped
Kuroda - 3 cards (2 pts, 2 pts, 3 pts) - 9 flipped
Anegakoji - 3 cards (2 pts, 2 pts, 2 pts) - 7 flipped

All clans use real Japanese family names and crests, and have been designed to match the original style.
I ordered my cards from https://www.printplaygames.com/
 - Custom Size Rectangular Cards #1
 - Matte Premium Black Core
 - length and width 2.75 inches

Front and back templates are attached.

Name: UNO: Trolls World Tour
Description:
Sing, dance, and hug... then play this Trolls World Tour edition of UNO!

Includes an exclusive "Tiny Diamond's Mix Tape Rule," which forces the next player to draw a card from each player's hand.

And don't forget to yell "UNO!" before the party is over!
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: The Offensive Band Name Generator: Album Cover Expansion
Description:
This is an expansion for the party game The Offensive Band Name Generator. It includes 50 Album Cover cards, 2 brand new Theme Lists and a rules sheet.

With this expansion, players will draw album cover cards and work to make band names and album names that best fit the images drawn.

Name: Porcupine Pop
Description:
Who will make the porcupine pop? This exciting kids' game combines simple play with silliness and suspense. Roll the die, press the porcupine's nose that number of times, and hope his darts don't fly out. No one knows when that will happen, and the only player not to make the porcupine pop wins. Kids can switch up the gameplay and try a round where whoever makes him pop first wins. Or try a game where each dart color is assigned points and when the porcupine pops, players race to grab as many darts as they can, and the player with the most points wins.

—description from the publisher
